column4: is there a way of doing more reliable copies, something that maybe do a MD5 check after the copy and retries if it does not match?
that would make copies much slower
well, cp assumes your hardware is reliable :)
mine isn't obviously. cp did not work for me :(
then you have a faulty hardware, what is exactly your problem ?

I want to backup my complete home folder, about 25G, to a USB drive and then do a clean install of Ubuntu on my pc. I have tried a normal "cp" but afterwards I could not open some of the photos that I backed up. Is there a better tool for doing this?
that is very odd, either your USB is failing or you are hitting a bug
are you using an ext3 partition ?
ext4 on usb and ext3 on harddisk
please check the release notes, there is a known issue with ext3 and large files
your problem is not about the copy tool, you have a system or hw problem that os corrupting the copy
you can use rsync, which does validate contents, at least it will do it on the second copy
but again, it will just be retrying over your problem
is there maybe an easy way of backing up to dvd?
no idea, i always backup to usb :\
